ChatGPT said:

You should replace the existing editTask function in your current JavaScript code on the Performance Calendar HTML page with the modified version you provided. Hereâ€™s how to do it step by step:

  1. Locate the Existing JavaScript Code: Find the <script> section of your HTML file where the original editTask function is defined. It should look similar to the code you shared earlier.

  2. Replace the Function: Delete the existing editTask function and paste the new function code in its place.

Hereâ€™s what it should look like in the context of your full script:

html
<!-- JavaScript for Calendar Navigation and Adding Tasks/Events -->
<script>
    let currentMonth = {{ current_month }};
    let currentYear = {{ current_year }};
    
    function changeMonth(direction) {
        currentMonth += direction;
        if (currentMonth < 1) {
            currentMonth = 12;
            currentYear -= 1;
        } else if (currentMonth > 12) {
            currentMonth = 1;
            currentYear += 1;
        }
        document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear;

        // Hide all calendars and show the selected month
        const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
        calendars.forEach(calendar => {
            const monthYear = calendar.querySelector('h3').innerText;
            if (monthYear.includes(currentMonth) && monthYear.includes(currentYear)) {
                calendar.style.display = 'block';
            } else {
                calendar.style.display = 'none';
            }
        });
    }

    function addTask() {
        const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task');
        const taskName = taskInput.value.trim();
        if (taskName) {
            fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', { // Adjust the URL as per your setup
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}',
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName }),
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                if (data.success) {
                    // Update the To-Do list with the new task
                    const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list');
                    const newTask = document.createElement('li');
                    newTask.style.backgroundColor = 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9)';
                    newTask.style.padding = '15px';
                    newTask.style.marginBottom = '10px';
                    newTask.style.boxShadow = '0 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)';
                    newTask.style.borderRadius = '5px';
                    newTask.innerHTML = `
                        <input type="checkbox"> âœ”ï¸ ${taskName}
                        <button onclick="editTask(${data.task_id})" style="margin-left: 10px; background-color: #FF6347; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Edit</button>
                    `;
                    todoList.appendChild(newTask);
                    taskInput.value = ''; // Clear the input
                }
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error));
        }
    }

    function addEvent() {
        const eventName = document.getElementById('event-name').value.trim();
        const eventDate = document.getElementById('event-date').value;
        if (eventName && eventDate) {
            fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', { // Adjust the URL as per your setup
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}',
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate }),
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                if (data.success) {
                    // Update the calendar with the new event
                    const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
                    calendars.forEach(calendar => {
                        const monthYear = calendar.querySelector('h3').innerText;
                        if (monthYear.includes(eventDate)) {
                            const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
                            eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347';
                            eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold';
                            eventDiv.innerHTML = `ðŸŒŸ ${eventName}`;
                            // Append to the correct day
                            const dayCells = calendar.querySelectorAll('td');
                            dayCells.forEach(cell => {
                                if (cell.innerText.includes(new Date(eventDate).getDate())) {
                                    cell.appendChild(eventDiv);
                                }
                            });
                        }
                    });
                    document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input
                    document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the date input
                }
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error));
        }
    }
    
    // Replace the existing editTask function with this one
    function editTask(taskId) {
        const newTaskName = prompt("Edit Task:");
        if (newTaskName) {
            fetch(`/edit_task/${taskId}/`, { // Directly use the taskId in the URL
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}',
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: newTaskName }),
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                if (data.success) {
                    // Update the task in the list
                    const taskItem = document.querySelector(`li[data-id='${taskId}']`);
                    taskItem.innerHTML = `
                        <input type="checkbox"> âœ”ï¸ ${newTaskName}
                        <button onclick="editTask(${taskId})" style="margin-left: 10px; background-color: #FF6347; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Edit</button>
                    `;
                }
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error));
        }
    }
</script>

Summary of Steps:

  1. Locate the <script> section in your Performance Calendar HTML page.
  2. Replace the existing editTask function with the modified one.
  3. Save the changes to your HTML file.

After making these changes, you should be able to edit tasks correctly without encountering the NoReverseMatch error. If you need further assistance or have more questions, feel free to ask!

You said:
changes must be done when u click on the date to add an event and add buttons are not working
2/2
ChatGPT said:

To ensure that the changes are applied correctly when you click on a date to add an event and to troubleshoot the "Add" buttons not working, follow these steps:

1. Modify the Date Click Event for Adding Events

You should set up an event listener on the calendar dates that will allow users to add events directly when they click on a date. Hereâ€™s how you can do that:

Step 1: Identify the elements for the dates in your calendar. Make sure each date cell in your calendar has an appropriate class or identifier.

Step 2: Add a click event listener to each date cell to prompt for event details and add the event.

Hereâ€™s how to modify the JavaScript code to handle this:

javascript
function setupDateClickEvents() {
    const dayCells = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month td'); // Adjust the selector to match your calendar
    dayCells.forEach(cell => {
        cell.addEventListener('click', function() {
            const eventName = prompt("Enter event name:");
            if (eventName) {
                const eventDate = new Date(currentYear, currentMonth - 1, parseInt(cell.innerText)).toISOString().split('T')[0]; // Get the correct date
                addEvent(eventName, eventDate); // Call the function to add the event
            }
        });
    });
}

function addEvent(eventName, eventDate) {
    fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', { // Adjust the URL as per your setup
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
            'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}',
        },
        body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate }),
    })
    .then(response => response.json())
    .then(data => {
        if (data.success) {
            // Update the calendar with the new event
            const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
            calendars.forEach(calendar => {
                const monthYear = calendar.querySelector('h3').innerText;
                if (monthYear.includes(eventDate)) {
                    const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
                    eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347';
                    eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold';
                    eventDiv.innerHTML = `ðŸŒŸ ${eventName}`;
                    // Append to the correct day
                    const dayCells = calendar.querySelectorAll('td');
                    dayCells.forEach(cell => {
                        if (cell.innerText.includes(new Date(eventDate).getDate())) {
                            cell.appendChild(eventDiv);
                        }
                    });
                }
            });
        }
    })
    .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error));
}

Step 3: Call the setupDateClickEvents() function after your calendar is rendered to attach the click events to each date cell.

2. Ensure the Add Task/Event Buttons Work

If the buttons for adding tasks or events are not working, ensure the following:

  • Correct IDs/Classes: Ensure your button elements have the correct IDs or classes youâ€™re using in your JavaScript. Hereâ€™s an example:
html
<input type="text" id="new-task" placeholder="Add a new task" />
<button onclick="addTask()">Add Task</button>

<input type="text" id="event-name" placeholder="Event Name" />
<input type="date" id="event-date" />
<button onclick="addEvent()">Add Event</button>
  • Debugging: Add console.log statements inside your addTask and addEvent functions to check if they are being called correctly.

Example Integration

Hereâ€™s how you could integrate both the date-click functionality and ensuring buttons work:

html
<!-- HTML for Task and Event Adding -->
<input type="text" id="new-task" placeholder="Add a new task" />
<button onclick="addTask()">Add Task</button>

<div>
    <input type="text" id="event-name" placeholder="Event Name" />
    <input type="date" id="event-date" />
    <button onclick="addEvent()">Add Event</button>
</div>

<!-- Calendar and other elements go here -->

<!-- JavaScript -->
<script>
    // Your existing JavaScript functions (addTask, addEvent, etc.)

    // Call this function to set up date click events after the calendar is rendered
    setupDateClickEvents();
</script>

Summary of Steps:

  1. Add event listeners to each date cell in your calendar to allow adding events when clicked.
  2. Ensure the button IDs and classes are correctly linked in your JavaScript.
  3. Add debugging logs in your functions to verify theyâ€™re being called.

After implementing these changes, your event adding functionality should work when clicking on the dates, and the add buttons should function correctly as well. If you have any specific errors or issues, please share them for further assistance!

} }); } }); document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the date input } }) .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error)); taskItem.innerHTML = <input type="checkbox"> âœ”ï¸ ${newTaskName} <button onclick="editTask(${taskId})" style="margin-left: 10px; background-color: #FF6347; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Edit</button> ; } }) .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error)); } } function setupDateClickEvents() { const dayCells = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month td'); // Adjust the selector to match your calendar dayCells.forEach(cell => { cell.addEventListener('click', function() { const eventName = prompt("Enter event name:"); ChatGPT said:

To troubleshoot and resolve the issues with your calendar page where the buttons for adding events and tasks aren't working properly, we need to consider the following areas:

  1. Check JavaScript Errors: Make sure to check the browser's console for any JavaScript errors that may prevent your functions from executing. You can access the console by right-clicking on the page, selecting "Inspect," and navigating to the "Console" tab.

  2. Ensure Event Listeners Are Set Up Correctly: The setupDateClickEvents() function should be called after the calendar has been rendered. You can add a call to this function at the end of your JavaScript code.

  3. Correct Usage of the Add Event Function: The current implementation of adding events has some redundancy. The addEvent function is defined twice, which could lead to confusion. We need to streamline this.

Here's an updated version of your JavaScript and some changes to ensure everything works correctly:

html
<script>
    let currentMonth = {{ current_month }};
    let currentYear = {{ current_year }};
    
    function changeMonth(direction) {
        currentMonth += direction;
        if (currentMonth < 1) {
            currentMonth = 12;
            currentYear -= 1;
        } else if (currentMonth > 12) {
            currentMonth = 1;
            currentYear += 1;
        }
        document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear;

        // Hide all calendars and show the selected month
        const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
        calendars.forEach(calendar => {
            const monthYear = calendar.querySelector('h3').innerText;
            if (monthYear.includes(currentMonth) && monthYear.includes(currentYear)) {
                calendar.style.display = 'block';
            } else {
                calendar.style.display = 'none';
            }
        });
    }

    function addTask() {
        const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task');
        const taskName = taskInput.value.trim();
        if (taskName) {
            fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', { // Adjust the URL as per your setup
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}',
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName }),
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                if (data.success) {
                    // Update the To-Do list with the new task
                    const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list');
                    const newTask = document.createElement('li');
                    newTask.style.backgroundColor = 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9)';
                    newTask.style.padding = '15px';
                    newTask.style.marginBottom = '10px';
                    newTask.style.boxShadow = '0 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)';
                    newTask.style.borderRadius = '5px';
                    newTask.innerHTML = `
                        <input type="checkbox"> âœ”ï¸ ${taskName}
                        <button onclick="editTask(${data.task_id})" style="margin-left: 10px; background-color: #FF6347; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Edit</button>
                    `;
                    todoList.appendChild(newTask);
                    taskInput.value = ''; // Clear the input
                }
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error));
        }
    }

    function addEvent(eventName, eventDate) {
        fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', { // Adjust the URL as per your setup
            method: 'POST',
            headers: {
                'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}',
            },
            body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate }),
        })
        .then(response => response.json())
        .then(data => {
            if (data.success) {
                // Update the calendar with the new event
                const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
                calendars.forEach(calendar => {
                    const monthYear = calendar.querySelector('h3').innerText;
                    if (monthYear.includes(eventDate)) {
                        const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
                        eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347';
                        eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold';
                        eventDiv.innerHTML = `ðŸŒŸ ${eventName}`;
                        // Append to the correct day
                        const dayCells = calendar.querySelectorAll('td');
                        dayCells.forEach(cell => {
                            if (cell.innerText.includes(new Date(eventDate).getDate())) {
                                cell.appendChild(eventDiv);
                            }
                        });
                    }
                });
                document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input
                document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the date input
            }
        })
        .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error));
    }

    // This function will handle the click on a date cell
    function setupDateClickEvents() {
        const dayCells = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month td'); // Adjust the selector to match your calendar
        dayCells.forEach(cell => {
            cell.addEventListener('click', function() {
                const dayNumber = parseInt(cell.innerText);
                if (!isNaN(dayNumber)) { // Check if it's a valid day
                    const eventName = prompt("Enter event name:");
                    if (eventName) {
                        const eventDate = new Date(currentYear, currentMonth - 1, dayNumber).toISOString().split('T')[0]; // Get the correct date
                        addEvent(eventName, eventDate); // Call the function to add the event
                    }
                }
            });
        });
    }

    // Call setupDateClickEvents after the DOM is fully loaded
    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', setupDateClickEvents);
</script>

Key Changes Made:

  1. Consolidated the addEvent function: Removed the duplicate definition of addEvent. It now handles adding events consistently.

  2. Setup Click Events on Page Load: The setupDateClickEvents() function is now called when the DOM content is fully loaded, ensuring that event listeners are properly set on calendar day cells.

  3. Validation on Click: Added a check to ensure that the cell clicked is a valid day number before prompting for an event name.

Next Steps

  • Test: After making these changes, test the functionality to ensure the event addition and task functionality works as expected.
  • Check Backend URLs: Ensure that the URLs in your fetch requests are correctly set up in your Django backend for adding tasks and events.

ChatGPT said:

To ensure your calendar navigation and rendering work properly, letâ€™s debug the issues in your JavaScript and HTML code. Here are a few adjustments that might help:

JavaScript Changes

  1. Refactor Calendar Rendering Logic: Ensure the calendars are being toggled correctly when navigating through months.
  2. Ensure Correct Date Calculations: Ensure that the event handlers are set up to correctly calculate the selected dayâ€™s date.

Code Adjustments

Here's an updated version of your code:

html
{% extends 'base.html' %}
{% load static %}
{% block content %}

<!-- Navbar included from navbar.html -->
{% include 'navbar.html' %}

<!-- Main Page Container -->
<div class="calendar-container" style="padding: 20px; margin-top: 100px; position: relative; background-color: rgba(240, 248, 255, 0.9); border-radius: 10px; box-shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);">

    <!-- Heading for Performance Calendar -->
    <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 2.5rem; margin-bottom: 30px;">ðŸ—“ï¸ Performance Calendar</h2>

    <!-- Navigation Arrows -->
    <div style="text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px;">
        <button onclick="changeMonth(-1)" style="font-size: 1.5rem; background-color: #59826b; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px; padding: 10px 15px;">&#10094;</button> <!-- Left Arrow -->
        <span id="current-month" style="margin: 0 20px; font-size: 1.5rem; color: #3B6B8A;">{{ current_month }} - {{ current_year }}</span>
        <button onclick="changeMonth(1)" style="font-size: 1.5rem; background-color: #59826b; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px; padding: 10px 15px;">&#10095;</button> <!-- Right Arrow -->
    </div>

    <!-- Calendar Section: Generate calendars for the specified year -->
    <div class="calendars">
        <!-- Loop through months -->
        {% for month in months %}
        <div class="calendar-month" style="margin-bottom: 40px; display: {% if month.month == current_month %}block{% else %}none{% endif %};">
            <h3 style="text-align: left; color: #2A4B38; margin-bottom: 15px;">
                {{ month.year }} - {{ month.month_name }} ðŸŒŸ <span style="font-size: 1rem; color: #aaa;">(Today: {{ today_date|date:"Y-m-d" }})</span>
            </h3>
            <table class="calendar-table" style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9);">
                <thead>
                    <tr style="background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white;">
                        <th>â˜€ï¸ Sun</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ™ Mon</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¼ Tue</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ· Wed</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¿ Thu</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒž Fri</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ» Sat</th>
                    </tr>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                    <!-- Loop through weeks and days -->
                    {% for week in month.weeks %}
                    <tr>
                        {% for day in week %}
                        <td style="padding: 10px; border: 1px solid #ddd; 
                                    text-align: left; 
                                    {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} 
                                    background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); 
                                    {% endif %}"
                                    data-date="{{ day.date }}">
                            {% if day.date %}
                                <span style="color: darkgreen; font-weight: bold;">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span> <!-- Day of the month -->
                                {% for event in important_events %}
                                    {% if event.date == day.date %}
                                        <div style="color: #FF6347; font-weight: bold;">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div>
                                    {% endif %}
                                {% endfor %}
                            {% else %}
                                &nbsp; <!-- Empty cell for unused days -->
                            {% endif %}
                        </td>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tr>
                    {% endfor %}
                </tbody>
            </table>
        </div>
        {% endfor %}
    </div>

    <!-- To-Do List Section -->
    <div class="todo-list-container" style="margin-top: 50px;">
        <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 1.75rem;">ðŸ“ To-Do List</h2>
        
        <!-- Input for New Task -->
        <div style="text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px;">
            <input type="text" id="new-task" placeholder="Add a new task..." style="padding: 10px; width: 50%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <button onclick="addTask()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Task</button>
        </div>
        
        <ul class="todo-list" style="list-style-type: none; padding-left: 0;">
            {% for task in todo_tasks %}
            <li style="background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9); padding: 15px; margin-bottom: 10px; box-shadow: 0 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); border-radius: 5px;">
                <input type="checkbox" {% if task.completed %}checked{% endif %} disabled> âœ”ï¸ {{ task.name }}
                <button onclick="editTask({{ task.id }})" style="margin-left: 10px; background-color: #FF6347; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Edit</button>
            </li>
            {% endfor %}
        </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Add Event Section -->
    <div style="margin-top: 50px;">
        <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 1.75rem;">ðŸŽ‰ Add Important Event</h2>
        <div style="text-align: center;">
            <input type="text" id="event-name" placeholder="Event name..." style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <input type="date" id="event-date" style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <button onclick="addEvent()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Event</button>
        </div>
    </div>

</div>

<!-- Custom Styling -->
<style>
    .calendar-table {
        background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9);
        border-radius: 10px;
        overflow: hidden;
        width: 100%;
    }

    .calendar-table th, .calendar-table td {
        padding: 10px;
        border: 1px solid #ddd;
        height: 80px; /* Set a height for each cell for a squared look */
        vertical-align: top; /* Align text to the top */
        text-align: left; /* Align text to the left */
    }

    .todo-list li {
        font-size: 1.2rem;
        color: #648c75;
    }
</style>

<!-- JavaScript for Calendar Navigation and Adding Tasks/Events -->
<script>
    let currentMonth = {{ current_month }};
    let currentYear = {{ current_year }};
    
    function changeMonth(direction) {
        currentMonth += direction;
        if (currentMonth < 1) {
            currentMonth = 12;
            currentYear -= 1;
        } else if (currentMonth > 12) {
            currentMonth = 1;
            currentYear += 1;
        }
        document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear;

        // Hide all calendars and show the selected month
        const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
        calendars.forEach(calendar => {
            const monthYear = calendar.querySelector('h3').innerText;
            if (monthYear.includes(currentMonth) && monthYear.includes(currentYear)) {
                calendar.style.display = 'block';
            } else {
                calendar.style.display = 'none';
            }
        });
    }

    function addTask() {
        const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task');
        const taskName = taskInput.value.trim();
        if (taskName) {
            fetch('{%
You said:

width: 50%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;"> <button onclick="addTask()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Task</button> </div> <ul class="todo-list" style="list-style-type: none; ChatGPT said:

Certainly! Hereâ€™s the continuation of your JavaScript code and a few final touches to ensure everything works as intended.

Continuing JavaScript Code

This part of the code includes the functionality for adding tasks and events, as well as some other helper functions. Let's complete it:

javascript
            fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                // Optionally update the UI with the new task
                const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list');
                const newTask = document.createElement('li');
                newTask.innerHTML = `<input type="checkbox" disabled> âœ”ï¸ ${data.name} <button onclick="editTask(${data.id})" style="margin-left: 10px; background-color: #FF6347; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Edit</button>`;
                todoList.appendChild(newTask);
                taskInput.value = ''; // Clear the input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding task:', error));
        }
    }

    function addEvent() {
        const eventName = document.getElementById('event-name').value.trim();
        const eventDate = document.getElementById('event-date').value;

        if (eventName && eventDate) {
            fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                // Optionally update the calendar with the new event
                const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
                calendars.forEach(calendar => {
                    const monthYear = calendar.querySelector('h3').innerText;
                    if (monthYear.includes(eventDate.substring(0, 7))) { // Check if the event month matches
                        const dayCells = calendar.querySelectorAll('td[data-date]');
                        dayCells.forEach(cell => {
                            if (cell.getAttribute('data-date') === eventDate) {
                                const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
                                eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347';
                                eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold';
                                eventDiv.innerText = `ðŸŒŸ ${eventName}`;
                                cell.appendChild(eventDiv);
                            }
                        });
                    }
                });

                document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear input
                document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear date input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding event:', error));
        }
    }
</script>

{% endblock %}

Explanation of Changes

  1. Fetch API for Adding Tasks and Events: I added fetch calls to submit new tasks and events to your server-side endpoints (add_task and add_event). Ensure these URLs match your Django URLs.

  2. Updating the UI: After adding a task or event, the script dynamically updates the UI to show the new item without needing a page refresh.

  3. Error Handling: I've included basic error handling to log errors to the console if the fetch request fails.

Final Check

  1. URL Configurations: Ensure your Django URLs are set up correctly to handle the POST requests for adding tasks and events.

  2. CSRF Token: Ensure that CSRF protection is correctly configured in your Django app, so the requests can go through.

  3. Test Functionality: Once implemented, test both adding tasks and events, navigating through the months in the calendar, and ensure that the UI updates as expected.

Summary

This should cover the necessary adjustments to ensure your calendar is functioning properly, with task and event management integrated seamlessly. Let me know if you need any more changes or have specific features you want to add!

ChatGPT said:

To implement your requirements for the Performance Calendar, here are the modifications you need to make in your HTML and JavaScript code:

  1. Show Only One Month at a Time: Modify the JavaScript function to display one month at a time.
  2. Checkbox for Task Completion: Remove the edit button for tasks and add a checkbox to mark tasks as completed.
  3. Clear the To-Do List for the Next Day: You can implement logic to clear the tasks based on the date.

Hereâ€™s the updated code snippet reflecting these changes:

html
<!-- Main Page Container -->
<div class="calendar-container" style="padding: 20px; margin-top: 100px; position: relative; background-color: rgba(240, 248, 255, 0.9); border-radius: 10px; box-shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);">

    <!-- Heading for Performance Calendar -->
    <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 2.5rem; margin-bottom: 30px;">ðŸ—“ï¸ Performance Calendar</h2>

    <!-- Navigation Arrows -->
    <div style="text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px;">
        <button onclick="changeMonth(-1)" style="font-size: 1.5rem; background-color: #59826b; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px; padding: 10px 15px;">&#10094;</button> <!-- Left Arrow -->
        <span id="current-month" style="margin: 0 20px; font-size: 1.5rem; color: #3B6B8A;">{{ current_month }} - {{ current_year }}</span>
        <button onclick="changeMonth(1)" style="font-size: 1.5rem; background-color: #59826b; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px; padding: 10px 15px;">&#10095;</button> <!-- Right Arrow -->
    </div>

    <!-- Calendar Section: Generate calendars for the specified year -->
    <div class="calendars">
        <!-- Loop through months -->
        {% for month in months %}
        <div class="calendar-month" style="margin-bottom: 40px; display: {% if month.month == current_month %}block{% else %}none{% endif %};">
            <h3 style="text-align: left; color: #2A4B38; margin-bottom: 15px;">
                {{ month.year }} - {{ month.month_name }} ðŸŒŸ <span style="font-size: 1rem; color: #aaa;">(Today: {{ today_date|date:"Y-m-d" }})</span>
            </h3>
            <table class="calendar-table" style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9);">
                <thead>
                    <tr style="background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white;">
                        <th>â˜€ï¸ Sun</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ™ Mon</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¼ Tue</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ· Wed</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¿ Thu</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒž Fri</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ» Sat</th>
                    </tr>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                    <!-- Loop through weeks and days -->
                    {% for week in month.weeks %}
                    <tr>
                        {% for day in week %}
                        <td style="padding: 10px; border: 1px solid #ddd; 
                                    text-align: left; 
                                    {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} 
                                    background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); 
                                    {% endif %}"
                                    data-date="{{ day.date }}">
                            {% if day.date %}
                                <span style="color: darkgreen; font-weight: bold;">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span> <!-- Day of the month -->
                                {% for event in important_events %}
                                    {% if event.date == day.date %}
                                        <div style="color: #FF6347; font-weight: bold;">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div>
                                    {% endif %}
                                {% endfor %}
                            {% else %}
                                &nbsp; <!-- Empty cell for unused days -->
                            {% endif %}
                        </td>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tr>
                    {% endfor %}
                </tbody>
            </table>
        </div>
        {% endfor %}
    </div>

    <!-- To-Do List Section -->
    <div class="todo-list-container" style="margin-top: 50px;">
        <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 1.75rem;">ðŸ“ To-Do List</h2>
        
        <!-- Input for New Task -->
        <div style="text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px;">
            <input type="text" id="new-task" placeholder="Add a new task..." style="padding: 10px; width: 50%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <button onclick="addTask()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Task</button>
        </div>
        
        <ul class="todo-list" style="list-style-type: none; padding-left: 0;">
            {% for task in todo_tasks %}
            <li style="background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9); padding: 15px; margin-bottom: 10px; box-shadow: 0 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); border-radius: 5px;">
                <input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask({{ task.id }})" {% if task.completed %}checked{% endif %}> âœ”ï¸ <span style="{% if task.completed %}text-decoration: line-through; color: gray;{% endif %}">{{ task.name }}</span>
            </li>
            {% endfor %}
        </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Add Event Section -->
    <div style="margin-top: 50px;">
        <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 1.75rem;">ðŸŽ‰ Add Important Event</h2>
        <div style="text-align: center;">
            <input type="text" id="event-name" placeholder="Event name..." style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <input type="date" id="event-date" style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <button onclick="addEvent()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Event</button>
        </div>
    </div>

</div>

<script>
    let currentMonth = {{ current_month }};
    let currentYear = {{ current_year }};

    // Function to show the current month and hide others
    function showCurrentMonth() {
        const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
        calendars.forEach(calendar => {
            calendar.style.display = 'none'; // Hide all
        });
        const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(`.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})`);
        if (currentCalendar) {
            currentCalendar.style.display = 'block'; // Show current month
        }
    }

    function changeMonth(direction) {
        currentMonth += direction;
        if (currentMonth < 1) {
            currentMonth = 12;
            currentYear -= 1;
        } else if (currentMonth > 12) {
            currentMonth = 1;
            currentYear += 1;
        }
        document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear;
        showCurrentMonth();
    }

    function addTask() {
        const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task');
        const taskName = taskInput.value.trim();
        if (taskName) {
            fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list');
                const newTask = document.createElement('li');
                newTask.innerHTML = `<input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask(${data.id})"> âœ”ï¸ <span>${data.name}</span>`;
                todoList.appendChild(newTask);
                taskInput.value = ''; // Clear the input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding task:', error));
        }
    }

    function completeTask(taskId) {
        const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(`input[onchange
You said:

ChatGPT said:

Hereâ€™s the continuation of your JavaScript code, focusing on the completion of tasks and the overall functionality of your Performance Calendar:

javascript
        const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(`input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]`);
        const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span

        // Update the completed status
        const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked;
        taskName.style.textDecoration = isChecked ? 'line-through' : 'none';
        taskName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black';

        // Send the completion status to the server
        fetch('{% url "complete_task" %}', {
            method: 'POST',
            headers: {
                'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
            },
            body: JSON.stringify({ id: taskId, completed: isChecked })
        })
        .catch(error => console.error('Error updating task completion:', error));
    }

    function addEvent() {
        const eventName = document.getElementById('event-name').value.trim();
        const eventDate = document.getElementById('event-date').value;

        if (eventName && eventDate) {
            fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(`.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})`);
                const dateCell = currentCalendar.querySelector(`td[data-date="${eventDate}"]`);
                if (dateCell) {
                    const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
                    eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347';
                    eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold';
                    eventDiv.innerHTML = `ðŸŒŸ ${data.name}`;
                    dateCell.appendChild(eventDiv);
                }
                document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input
                document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding event:', error));
        } else {
            alert('Please enter both event name and date!');
        }
    }

    // Show the current month when the page loads
    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', showCurrentMonth);
</script>

Key Updates:

  1. Task Completion Logic: The completeTask function updates the task's visual representation based on whether itâ€™s checked or not and sends the updated status to the server.
  2. Event Addition Logic: The addEvent function sends the new event to the server and displays it on the appropriate date in the calendar.
  3. Initial Month Display: The current month is displayed when the page loads by calling showCurrentMonth() inside a DOMContentLoaded event listener.

To Integrate:

Make sure you have the corresponding server-side routes for add_task, complete_task, and add_event that can handle the incoming POST requests from the JavaScript code.

Feel free to let me know if you need further modifications or additions!

'line-through' : 'none'; 163 taskName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black'; 164 165 // Send the completion status to the server 166 fetch('{% url "complete_task" %}', {
ChatGPT said:

The error you're encountering, NoReverseMatch, indicates that Django can't find a URL pattern named complete_task. Here are steps to resolve the issue:

1. Check URL Configuration

Ensure that you have a URL pattern defined in your urls.py file for complete_task. It should look something like this:

python
from django.urls import path
from . import views  # Adjust based on your app structure

urlpatterns = [
    # Other URL patterns
    path('complete_task/', views.complete_task, name='complete_task'),
    # Additional URL patterns
]

2. Implement the View Function

Make sure you have the corresponding view function in your views.py file. Here's an example of how it could look:

python
from django.http import JsonResponse
from .models import Task  # Adjust according to your model structure
import json

def complete_task(request):
    if request.method == 'POST':
        data = json.loads(request.body)
        task_id = data.get('id')
        completed_status = data.get('completed')

        try:
            task = Task.objects.get(id=task_id)
            task.completed = completed_status
            task.save()
            return JsonResponse({'status': 'success'})
        except Task.DoesNotExist:
            return JsonResponse({'status': 'error', 'message': 'Task not found'}, status=404)
    return JsonResponse({'status': 'error', 'message': 'Invalid request'}, status=400)

3. Verify URL Names

If you've changed the name of the URL pattern or if it exists in a different urls.py, ensure you use the correct name in your JavaScript code:

javascript
fetch('{% url "complete_task" %}', {
    method: 'POST',
    headers: {
        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
    },
    body: JSON.stringify({ id: taskId, completed: isChecked })
})

4. Check for Typos

Sometimes, the issue can stem from typos in the URL name or function names. Double-check for consistency in naming across your templates, URL configurations, and view functions.

5. Restart the Server

If you've made changes to your URL configurations, make sure to restart your Django development server to see the effects of those changes.

Final Checks

Once youâ€™ve verified and made any necessary changes, reload your Performance Calendar page and test the checkbox functionality again. If the error persists, feel free to provide additional details, and I'll help troubleshoot further!

To create a bigger calendar in your HTML, you can adjust the CSS properties of the calendar table and its cells. Here are some modifications you can apply to your existing code to increase the size of the calendar:

1. Update the Calendar Table Styles

Increase the width of the table and adjust the padding in the cells to make the calendar appear larger. You can modify the styles directly in your HTML or, preferably, use a CSS file for better organization.

Hereâ€™s how you can update your existing calendar styles:

html
<table class="calendar-table" style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9); font-size: 1.2rem;">
    <thead>
        <tr style="background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white;">
            <th style="width: 14.28%; padding: 20px;">â˜€ï¸ Sun</th>
            <th style="width: 14.28%; padding: 20px;">ðŸŒ™ Mon</th>
            <th style="width: 14.28%; padding: 20px;">ðŸŒ¼ Tue</th>
            <th style="width: 14.28%; padding: 20px;">ðŸŒ· Wed</th>
            <th style="width: 14.28%; padding: 20px;">ðŸŒ¿ Thu</th>
            <th style="width: 14.28%; padding: 20px;">ðŸŒž Fri</th>
            <th style="width: 14.28%; padding: 20px;">ðŸŒ» Sat</th>
        </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
        <!-- Loop through weeks and days -->
        {% for week in month.weeks %}
        <tr>
            {% for day in week %}
            <td style="padding: 30px; border: 1px solid #ddd; text-align: left; 
                        {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} 
                        background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); 
                        {% endif %}"
                        data-date="{{ day.date }}">
                {% if day.date %}
                    <span style="color: darkgreen; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.5rem;">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span> <!-- Day of the month -->
                    {% for event in important_events %}
                        {% if event.date == day.date %}
                            <div style="color: #FF6347; font-weight: bold;">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div>
                        {% endif %}
                    {% endfor %}
                {% else %}
                    &nbsp; <!-- Empty cell for unused days -->
                {% endif %}
            </td>
            {% endfor %}
        </tr>
        {% endfor %}
    </tbody>
</table>

2. General Styling

You can also consider adjusting the overall styles of the calendar container for more space:

html
<div class="calendar-container" style="padding: 40px; margin-top: 100px; position: relative; background-color: rgba(240, 248, 255, 0.9); border-radius: 10px; box-shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);">

3. Adjust Font Size

You might want to increase the font size of the header and other elements to match the larger calendar:

html
<h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 3rem; margin-bottom: 30px;">ðŸ—“ï¸ Performance Calendar</h2>

4. Additional CSS (Optional)

Consider adding a separate CSS class for your calendar to maintain clean code. Hereâ€™s an example:

css
.calendar-table {
    width: 100%;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    text-align: center;
    box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9);
    font-size: 1.2rem; /* Adjust font size */
}

.calendar-table th,
.calendar-table td {
    padding: 30px; /* Increase padding for larger cells */
    border: 1px solid #ddd; /* Cell border */
}

.calendar-container {
    padding: 40px; /* Increase padding for the container */
}

/* Update the heading size */
h2 {
    font-size: 3rem; /* Adjust heading size */
}

Implementation

Make these adjustments to your code, and it should result in a larger calendar display. After updating, be sure to refresh your web page to see the changes. Let me know if you need any more modifications or assistance!

ChatGPT said:

To make the calendar numbers smaller and ensure that added events are displayed clearly, you can adjust the CSS properties for the font sizes and ensure the event display is well integrated into the calendar layout. Hereâ€™s how you can achieve that:

1. Update Font Sizes for Calendar Numbers

To make the day numbers smaller, you can modify the font-size in the <span> element where the day number is displayed. Hereâ€™s the updated code snippet for the calendar:

html
<td style="padding: 30px; border: 1px solid #ddd; text-align: left; 
            {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} 
            background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); 
            {% endif %}"
            data-date="{{ day.date }}">
    {% if day.date %}
        <span style="color: darkgreen; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1rem;">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span> <!-- Day of the month -->
        {% for event in important_events %}
            {% if event.date == day.date %}
                <div style="color: #FF6347; font-weight: bold; font-size: 0.9rem;">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div> <!-- Smaller font size for events -->
            {% endif %}
        {% endfor %}
    {% else %}
        &nbsp; <!-- Empty cell for unused days -->
    {% endif %}
</td>

2. Adjust Overall Calendar Size

If you want to keep the overall calendar size a bit smaller while making the day numbers smaller, you can adjust the padding in the table cells:

html
<td style="padding: 20px; border: 1px solid #ddd; text-align: left; 
            {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} 
            background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); 
            {% endif %}"
            data-date="{{ day.date }}">
    {% if day.date %}
        <span style="color: darkgreen; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1rem;">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span> <!-- Smaller day number -->
        {% for event in important_events %}
            {% if event.date == day.date %}
                <div style="color: #FF6347; font-weight: bold; font-size: 0.9rem;">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div> <!-- Smaller font size for events -->
            {% endif %}
        {% endfor %}
    {% else %}
        &nbsp; <!-- Empty cell for unused days -->
    {% endif %}
</td>

3. Ensure Events Are Displayed

Make sure that your events are being added correctly in the backend and that the important_events variable in your Django template is populated with the correct data. Hereâ€™s an example of how to ensure that your events are retrieved correctly:

python
# Example: In your Django view
from django.shortcuts import render
from .models import Event

def performance_calendar(request):
    # Fetch events for the current month
    today = timezone.now()
    current_month = today.month
    current_year = today.year
    important_events = Event.objects.filter(date__month=current_month, date__year=current_year)

    # Your existing logic to create the calendar...

    return render(request, 'performance_calendar.html', {
        'current_month': current_month,
        'current_year': current_year,
        'important_events': important_events,
        # Add other context variables...
    })

4. Example CSS for Styling (Optional)

If you want to centralize your styles, you can use CSS classes instead of inline styles:

css
.calendar-table {
    width: 100%;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    text-align: center;
    box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9);
}

.calendar-table th,
.calendar-table td {
    padding: 20px; /* Adjust cell padding for smaller overall size */
}

.calendar-table td span {
    color: darkgreen;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 1rem; /* Smaller day number */
}

.calendar-table td div {
    color: #FF6347;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 0.9rem; /* Smaller font size for events */
}

/* Calendar container */
.calendar-container {
    padding: 40px; /* Adjust padding for container */
}

/* Update heading size */
h2 {
    font-size: 2.5rem; /* Adjust heading size */
}

Summary

  1. Reduce the font-size for both the day numbers and events to ensure they fit well within the calendar layout.
  2. Adjust the padding in the calendar cells to make the overall size smaller.
  3. Verify that events are being correctly retrieved from the backend and displayed in the calendar.

With these changes, your calendar should now have smaller day numbers while ensuring that events are visible and clearly displayed. Let me know if you need further adjustments or assistance!

ChatGPT said:

Here's the complete code for your Performance Calendar with smaller calendar numbers, a better layout for events, and some styling improvements.

Updated HTML Template (performance_calendar.html)

html
<!-- Main Page Container -->
<div class="calendar-container" style="padding: 20px; margin-top: 100px; position: relative; background-color: rgba(240, 248, 255, 0.9); border-radius: 10px; box-shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);">

    <!-- Heading for Performance Calendar -->
    <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 2.5rem; margin-bottom: 30px;">ðŸ—“ï¸ Performance Calendar</h2>

    <!-- Navigation Arrows -->
    <div style="text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px;">
        <button onclick="changeMonth(-1)" style="font-size: 1.5rem; background-color: #59826b; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px; padding: 10px 15px;">&#10094;</button> <!-- Left Arrow -->
        <span id="current-month" style="margin: 0 20px; font-size: 1.5rem; color: #3B6B8A;">{{ current_month }} - {{ current_year }}</span>
        <button onclick="changeMonth(1)" style="font-size: 1.5rem; background-color: #59826b; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px; padding: 10px 15px;">&#10095;</button> <!-- Right Arrow -->
    </div>

    <!-- Calendar Section: Generate calendars for the specified year -->
    <div class="calendars">
        <!-- Loop through months -->
        {% for month in months %}
        <div class="calendar-month" style="margin-bottom: 40px; display: {% if month.month == current_month %}block{% else %}none{% endif %};">
            <h3 style="text-align: left; color: #2A4B38; margin-bottom: 15px;">
                {{ month.year }} - {{ month.month_name }} ðŸŒŸ <span style="font-size: 1rem; color: #aaa;">(Today: {{ today_date|date:"Y-m-d" }})</span>
            </h3>
            <table class="calendar-table" style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9);">
                <thead>
                    <tr style="background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white;">
                        <th>â˜€ï¸ Sun</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ™ Mon</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¼ Tue</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ· Wed</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¿ Thu</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒž Fri</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ» Sat</th>
                    </tr>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                    <!-- Loop through weeks and days -->
                    {% for week in month.weeks %}
                    <tr>
                        {% for day in week %}
                        <td style="padding: 20px; border: 1px solid #ddd; text-align: left; 
                                    {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} 
                                    background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); 
                                    {% endif %}"
                                    data-date="{{ day.date }}">
                            {% if day.date %}
                                <span style="color: darkgreen; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1rem;">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span> <!-- Day of the month -->
                                {% for event in important_events %}
                                    {% if event.date == day.date %}
                                        <div style="color: #FF6347; font-weight: bold; font-size: 0.9rem;">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div>
                                    {% endif %}
                                {% endfor %}
                            {% else %}
                                &nbsp; <!-- Empty cell for unused days -->
                            {% endif %}
                        </td>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tr>
                    {% endfor %}
                </tbody>
            </table>
        </div>
        {% endfor %}
    </div>

    <!-- To-Do List Section -->
    <div class="todo-list-container" style="margin-top: 50px;">
        <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 1.75rem;">ðŸ“ To-Do List</h2>
        
        <!-- Input for New Task -->
        <div style="text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px;">
            <input type="text" id="new-task" placeholder="Add a new task..." style="padding: 10px; width: 50%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <button onclick="addTask()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Task</button>
        </div>
        
        <ul class="todo-list" style="list-style-type: none; padding-left: 0;">
            {% for task in todo_tasks %}
            <li style="background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9); padding: 15px; margin-bottom: 10px; box-shadow: 0 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); border-radius: 5px;">
                <input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask({{ task.id }})" {% if task.completed %}checked{% endif %}> âœ”ï¸ <span style="{% if task.completed %}text-decoration: line-through; color: gray;{% endif %}">{{ task.name }}</span>
            </li>
            {% endfor %}
        </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Add Event Section -->
    <div style="margin-top: 50px;">
        <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 1.75rem;">ðŸŽ‰ Add Important Event</h2>
        <div style="text-align: center;">
            <input type="text" id="event-name" placeholder="Event name..." style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <input type="date" id="event-date" style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;">
            <button onclick="addEvent()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Event</button>
        </div>
    </div>

</div>

<script>
    let currentMonth = {{ current_month }};
    let currentYear = {{ current_year }};

    // Function to show the current month and hide others
    function showCurrentMonth() {
        const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
        calendars.forEach(calendar => {
            calendar.style.display = 'none'; // Hide all
        });
        const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(`.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})`);
        if (currentCalendar) {
            currentCalendar.style.display = 'block'; // Show current month
        }
    }

    function changeMonth(direction) {
        currentMonth += direction;
        if (currentMonth < 1) {
            currentMonth = 12;
            currentYear -= 1;
        } else if (currentMonth > 12) {
            currentMonth = 1;
            currentYear += 1;
        }
        document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear;
        showCurrentMonth();
    }

    function addTask() {
        const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task');
        const taskName = taskInput.value.trim();
        if (taskName) {
            fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list');
                const newTask = document.createElement('li');
                newTask.innerHTML = `<input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask(${data.id})"> âœ”ï¸ <span>${data.name}</span>`;
                todoList.appendChild(newTask);
                taskInput.value = ''; // Clear the input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding task:', error));
        }
    }

    function completeTask(taskId) {
        const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(`input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]`);
        const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span

        // Update the completed status
        const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked;
        taskName.style.textDecoration = isChecked ? 'line-through' : 'none';
        task

ChatGPT said:

Here's the continuation and completion of your JavaScript code, including the functions for completing tasks, adding events, and refreshing the calendar display:

javascript
        taskName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black';

        // Send update to the server (implement this as needed)
        fetch(`{% url "complete_task" taskId=taskId %}`, {
            method: 'POST',
            headers: {
                'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
            },
            body: JSON.stringify({ completed: isChecked })
        }).catch(error => console.error('Error completing task:', error));
    }

    function addEvent() {
        const eventName = document.getElementById('event-name').value.trim();
        const eventDate = document.getElementById('event-date').value;

        if (eventName && eventDate) {
            fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                // Add the event to the appropriate date in the calendar
                const dateCell = document.querySelector(`td[data-date="${eventDate}"]`);
                if (dateCell) {
                    const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
                    eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347';
                    eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold';
                    eventDiv.style.fontSize = '0.9rem';
                    eventDiv.textContent = `ðŸŒŸ ${data.name}`;
                    dateCell.appendChild(eventDiv);
                }
                document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input
                document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the date input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding event:', error));
        } else {
            alert('Please enter both event name and date.');
        }
    }

    // Initial call to show the current month
    showCurrentMonth();
</script>

Summary of Key Features

  • Calendar Display: Each month is displayed with the correct days and events.
  • Event Management: Users can add events to specific dates, which will show up in the calendar.
  • To-Do List: Users can add tasks, mark them as completed, and have them visually cut through.
  • Navigation: Users can navigate between months using arrows.
  • Dynamic Updates: The calendar updates dynamically based on user input.

Notes:

  1. URLs: Make sure to replace {% url "add_task" %}, {% url "complete_task" taskId=taskId %}, and {% url "add_event" %} with your actual endpoint URLs for adding tasks and events.
  2. Event Dates: Ensure that the format used in the data-date attribute matches how dates are formatted in your back-end database to ensure accurate functionality.
  3. Styling: You can adjust the styles further in your CSS file for a more consistent design.

Feel free to integrate this code into your application and modify it as needed! If you have any further questions or need additional modifications, let me know!

ChatGPT said:

The error you're encountering, NoReverseMatch, suggests that the URL pattern for the complete_task view is not being matched correctly in your Django template. Specifically, it looks like the taskId variable is not being correctly passed when trying to generate the URL.

Fixing the URL Reversal

  1. Ensure URL Pattern Exists: First, verify that you have a URL pattern defined for complete_task in your Django urls.py. It should look something like this:

    python
    from django.urls import path
from .views import complete_task_view

urlpatterns = [
    # other URL patterns
    path('complete_task/<int:taskId>/', complete_task_view, name='complete_task'),
]

  2. Use Template Variable: When you're passing the taskId in your JavaScript, ensure it is correctly referenced. Instead of using a URL template tag inside your JavaScript function, use a string interpolation for the URL.

Update the JavaScript Function

Here's how to update your JavaScript function to correctly reference the taskId:

javascript
function completeTask(taskId) {
    const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(`input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]`);
    const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span

    // Update the completed status
    const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked;
    taskName.style.textDecoration = isChecked ? 'line-through' : 'none';
    taskName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black';

    // Send update to the server using string interpolation for the URL
    fetch(`/complete_task/${taskId}/`, {  // Change this line
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
            'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
        },
        body: JSON.stringify({ completed: isChecked })
    })
    .then(response => {
        if (!response.ok) {
            throw new Error('Network response was not ok');
        }
    })
    .catch(error => console.error('Error completing task:', error));
}

Explanation of Changes

  1. URL Change: Instead of using {% url "complete_task" taskId=taskId %}, the fetch URL has been replaced with a direct path string: /complete_task/${taskId}/. This ensures that it correctly captures the taskId when making the fetch request.

  2. Error Handling: Added a check to handle any network errors more gracefully.

Summary

Make sure that the URL patterns are defined correctly, and adjust the JavaScript code to directly construct the fetch URL. With these changes, the NoReverseMatch error should be resolved, allowing your task completion functionality to work as intended.

If you need further assistance or if other errors arise, feel free to ask!
