ChatGPT said:

The NoReverseMatch error you're encountering indicates that the taskId being passed to the URL is empty (''). This typically happens when the JavaScript function completeTask is called without a valid taskId. Here are steps to troubleshoot and resolve the issue:

Steps to Fix the Error

  1. Check the Invocation of completeTask: Ensure that the completeTask function is being called with a valid taskId. This usually happens in an event listener or directly within your HTML. Here's an example of how it might be done in an HTML template:

    html
    <input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask({{ task.id }})">
<span>{{ task.name }}</span>

    Ensure that you have something like {{ task.id }} that correctly outputs the ID of each task.

  2. Modify the JavaScript Fetch Call: Instead of using the Django template language directly inside the JavaScript function, you can build the URL dynamically. Hereâ€™s how to update the function correctly:

    javascript
    function completeTask(taskId) {
    const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(`input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]`);
    const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span

    // Update the completed status
    const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked;
    taskName.style.textDecoration = isChecked ? 'line-through' : 'none';
    taskName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black';

    // Send update to the server using string interpolation for the URL
    fetch(`/complete_task/${taskId}/`, {  // Change this line to build URL dynamically
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
            'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'  // Ensure CSRF token is included
        },
        body: JSON.stringify({ completed: isChecked })
    })
    .then(response => {
        if (!response.ok) {
            throw new Error('Network response was not ok');
        }
    })
    .catch(error => console.error('Error completing task:', error));
}

Double-Check Your HTML

Make sure that when rendering the list of tasks, each task ID is being passed correctly to the completeTask function. Hereâ€™s an example:

html
<ul>
    {% for task in tasks %}
        <li>
            <input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask({{ task.id }})">
            <span>{{ task.name }}</span>
        </li>
    {% endfor %}
</ul>

Additional Tips

  • Debugging: Add console logs inside the completeTask function to log the taskId:

    javascript
    console.log('Task ID:', taskId);

  • Check the Backend: Make sure your view handling the complete_task route is properly set up to handle the task completion logic.

Summary

The issue seems to stem from either the taskId not being passed correctly when calling completeTask or the fetch URL construction. Adjusting the JavaScript as shown should resolve the NoReverseMatch error. If you continue to face issues, feel free to share additional snippets or error messages!

You said:
give me entire code without java script
ChatGPT said:

Sure! Below is a complete example of your Django performance_calendar.html template without the JavaScript for handling task completion. This example will render a list of tasks with checkboxes but will not include any JavaScript functionality for completing the tasks.

performance_calendar.html

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Performance Calendar</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static 'calc/styles.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Performance Calendar</h1>

        <!-- Calendar Section -->
        <div class="calendar">
            <!-- Render your calendar here -->
            {% for week in calendar %}
                <div class="week">
                    {% for day in week %}
                        <div class="day">
                            <span>{{ day.date }}</span>
                            <span>{% if day.is_today %}Today{% endif %}</span>
                        </div>
                    {% endfor %}
                </div>
            {% endfor %}
        </div>

        <!-- To-Do List Section -->
        <h2>To-Do List</h2>
        <ul>
            {% for task in tasks %}
                <li>
                    <input type="checkbox" id="task_{{ task.id }}" name="task_{{ task.id }}">
                    <label for="task_{{ task.id }}">{{ task.name }}</label>
                </li>
            {% endfor %}
        </ul>
    </div>
</body>
</html>

Explanation

  • Calendar Section: Replace the comments in the calendar section with your logic to render the calendar. Each week and day can be displayed based on your context data.

  • To-Do List Section: This section creates a list of tasks with checkboxes. Each task is associated with an ID for potential future use, but without JavaScript, it won't trigger any functionality when checked.

Additional Notes

  • Static Files: Ensure that your CSS file path is correct in the <link> tag (replace 'calc/styles.css' with the actual path if it differs).

  • Styling: You might want to add CSS to style the calendar and to-do list according to your preferences.

  • Django Context: This template expects calendar and tasks to be passed as context from your Django view. Make sure your view is set up to provide this data when rendering the template.

Example Django View (for reference)

If you need a basic example of how to render this template from a Django view, hereâ€™s a simple example:

python
from django.shortcuts import render
from .models import Task  # Assuming you have a Task model

def performance_calendar(request):
    # Example data for calendar
    calendar = [
        [{'date': '1', 'is_today': False}, {'date': '2', 'is_today': False}, ...],  # Add the rest of the days
    ]
    
    # Fetch tasks from the database
    tasks = Task.objects.all()

    context = {
        'calendar': calendar,
        'tasks': tasks,
    }
    
    return render(request, 'performance_calendar.html', context)

This view fetches tasks from the database and constructs a simple calendar for display in the template. Youâ€™ll need to adjust the calendar data structure to suit your needs.

If you have any further questions or need more modifications, feel free to ask!

You said:
give me the entire code
ChatGPT said:

Here's a complete code example for your Django performance_calendar.html template and the corresponding view, including models and URL configuration. This will create a basic performance calendar with a to-do list, and the example doesn't include any JavaScript functionality.

1. Django Model (models.py)

python
from django.db import models

class Task(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=200)
    completed = models.BooleanField(default=False)

    def __str__(self):
        return self.name

2. Django View (views.py)

python
from django.shortcuts import render
from .models import Task
from datetime import datetime
import calendar

def performance_calendar(request):
    # Get current month and year
    now = datetime.now()
    month = now.month
    year = now.year

    # Create a calendar
    cal = calendar.Calendar()
    month_days = cal.monthdayscalendar(year, month)

    # Fetch tasks from the database
    tasks = Task.objects.all()

    context = {
        'calendar': month_days,
        'tasks': tasks,
        'month': month,
        'year': year,
    }

    return render(request, 'performance_calendar.html', context)

3. URL Configuration (urls.py)

python
from django.urls import path
from .views import performance_calendar

urlpatterns = [
    path('performance-calendar/', performance_calendar, name='performance_calendar'),
]

4. HTML Template (performance_calendar.html)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Performance Calendar</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static 'calc/styles.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Performance Calendar - {{ month }}/{{ year }}</h1>

        <!-- Calendar Section -->
        <div class="calendar">
            {% for week in calendar %}
                <div class="week">
                    {% for day in week %}
                        <div class="day">
                            <span>{{ day }}</span>
                            <span>{% if day == now.day %}Today{% endif %}</span>
                        </div>
                    {% endfor %}
                </div>
            {% endfor %}
        </div>

        <!-- To-Do List Section -->
        <h2>To-Do List</h2>
        <ul>
            {% for task in tasks %}
                <li>
                    <input type="checkbox" id="task_{{ task.id }}" name="task_{{ task.id }}" {% if task.completed %}checked{% endif %}>
                    <label for="task_{{ task.id }}">{{ task.name }}</label>
                </li>
            {% endfor %}
        </ul>
    </div>
</body>
</html>

5. CSS File (styles.css)

Create a basic CSS file for styling. Hereâ€™s a simple example:

css
body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f4f4f4;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 20px;
}

.container {
    max-width: 800px;
    margin: auto;
    background: white;
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.calendar {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: repeat(7, 1fr);
    gap: 10px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.week {
    display: contents;
}

.day {
    padding: 10px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    text-align: center;
    border-radius: 4px;
    background-color: #e9e9e9;
}

h2 {
    margin-top: 40px;
}

ul {
    list-style-type: none;
    padding: 0;
}

li {
    margin: 10px 0;
}

6. Database Migrations

Run the following commands to create the database table for the Task model:

bash
python manage.py makemigrations
python manage.py migrate

7. Add Tasks

You can add tasks directly from the Django admin panel or through a custom form if you implement one.

Summary

This code provides a basic structure for your performance calendar application in Django. You can view the calendar and the tasks with checkboxes. The current day will be highlighted, and you can see whether tasks are completed based on their state in the database.

Feel free to modify the styles, layout, or functionality to better fit your needs. If you need additional features or assistance, let me know!

// Function to show the current month and hide others function showCurrentMonth() { const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month'); calendars.forEach(calendar => { calendar.style.display = 'none'; // Hide all }); const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})); if (currentCalendar) { currentCalendar.style.display = 'block'; // Show current month } } function changeMonth(direction) { currentMonth += direction; if (currentMonth < 1) { currentMonth = 12; currentYear -= 1; } else if (currentMonth > 12) { currentMonth = 1; currentYear += 1; } document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear; showCurrentMonth(); } function addTask() { const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task'); const taskName = taskInput.value.trim(); if (taskName) { fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}' }, body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName }) }) .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => { const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list'); // Clear the input }) .catch(error => console.error('Error adding task:', error)); } } function completeTask(taskId) { const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]); const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span // Update the completed status const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked; taskName.style.textDecoration = isChecked ? 'line-through' : 'none'; taskName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black'; // Send update to the server using string interpolation for the URL fetch(/complete_task/${taskId}/, { // Change this line to build URL dynamically method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}' // Ensure CSRF token is included }, body: JSON.stringify({ completed: isChecked }) }) .then(response => { if (!response.ok) { throw new Error('Network response was not ok'); } }) .catch(error => console.error('Error completing task:', error)); } function completeTask(taskId) { const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]); const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span // Update the completed status const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked; taskName.style.textDecoration = isChecked ? 'line-through' : 'none'; askName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black'; // Send update to the server (implement this as needed) fetch({% url "complete_task" taskId=taskId %}, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}' }, body: JSON.stringify({ completed: isChecked }) }).catch(error => console.error('Error completing task:', error)); } function addEvent() { const eventName = document.getElementById('event-name').value.trim(); const eventDate = document.getElementById('event-date').value; if (eventName && eventDate) { fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}' }, body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate }) }) .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => { // Add the event to the appropriate date in the calendar const dateCell = document.querySelector(td[data-date="${eventDate}"]); if (dateCell) { const eventDiv = document.createElement('div'); eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347'; eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold'; eventDiv.style.fontSize = '0.9rem'; eventDiv.textContent = ðŸŒŸ ${data.name}; dateCell.appendChild(eventDiv); } document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the date input }) .catch(error => console.error('Error adding event:', error)); } else { alert('Please enter both event name and date.'); } } // Initial call to show the current month showCurrentMonth(); </script> {% endblock %} using java script only give good version
ChatGPT said:

Sure! Below is a revised version of your performance_calendar.html template, which includes a more organized structure for JavaScript code, better styling, and improved functionality. This version enhances readability and maintains good practices for JavaScript. Iâ€™ve added comments throughout the JavaScript to explain its purpose, and ensured that you have a clear separation between HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Revised performance_calendar.html

html
{% extends 'base.html' %}
{% load static %}

{% block content %}

<!-- Main Page Container -->
<div class="calendar-container">
    <h2 class="calendar-heading">ðŸ—“ï¸ Performance Calendar</h2>

    <!-- Navigation Arrows -->
    <div class="navigation">
        <button class="nav-button" onclick="changeMonth(-1)">&#10094;</button> <!-- Left Arrow -->
        <span id="current-month" class="current-month">{{ current_month }} - {{ current_year }}</span>
        <button class="nav-button" onclick="changeMonth(1)">&#10095;</button> <!-- Right Arrow -->
    </div>

    <!-- Calendar Section: Generate calendars for the specified year -->
    <div class="calendars">
        {% for month in months %}
        <div class="calendar-month" style="display: {% if month.month == current_month %}block{% else %}none{% endif %};">
            <h3 class="month-heading">{{ month.year }} - {{ month.month_name }} ðŸŒŸ <span class="today-date">(Today: {{ today_date|date:"Y-m-d" }})</span></h3>
            <table class="calendar-table">
                <thead>
                    <tr class="table-header">
                        <th>â˜€ï¸ Sun</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ™ Mon</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¼ Tue</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ· Wed</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ¿ Thu</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒž Fri</th>
                        <th>ðŸŒ» Sat</th>
                    </tr>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                    {% for week in month.weeks %}
                    <tr>
                        {% for day in week %}
                        <td class="calendar-day" data-date="{{ day.date }}" style="{% if day.date and day.date == today_date %}background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3);{% endif %}">
                            {% if day.date %}
                                <span class="day-number">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span>
                                {% for event in important_events %}
                                    {% if event.date == day.date %}
                                        <div class="event-name">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div>
                                    {% endif %}
                                {% endfor %}
                            {% else %}
                                &nbsp; <!-- Empty cell for unused days -->
                            {% endif %}
                        </td>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tr>
                    {% endfor %}
                </tbody>
            </table>
        </div>
        {% endfor %}
    </div>

    <!-- To-Do List Section -->
    <div class="todo-list-container">
        <h2 class="todo-heading">ðŸ“ To-Do List</h2>
        <div class="todo-input">
            <input type="text" id="new-task" placeholder="Add a new task..." class="task-input">
            <button onclick="addTask()" class="add-task-button">Add Task</button>
        </div>
        
        <ul class="todo-list">
            {% for task in todo_tasks %}
            <li class="todo-item">
                <input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask({{ task.id }})" {% if task.completed %}checked{% endif %}> 
                <span class="task-name {% if task.completed %}completed{% endif %}">{{ task.name }}</span>
            </li>
            {% endfor %}
        </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Add Event Section -->
    <div class="event-container">
        <h2 class="event-heading">ðŸŽ‰ Add Important Event</h2>
        <div class="event-input">
            <input type="text" id="event-name" placeholder="Event name..." class="event-name-input">
            <input type="date" id="event-date" class="event-date-input">
            <button onclick="addEvent()" class="add-event-button">Add Event</button>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

<!-- JavaScript Section -->
<script>
    let currentMonth = {{ current_month }};
    let currentYear = {{ current_year }};

    // Function to show the current month and hide others
    function showCurrentMonth() {
        const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month');
        calendars.forEach(calendar => {
            calendar.style.display = 'none'; // Hide all
        });
        const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(`.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})`);
        if (currentCalendar) {
            currentCalendar.style.display = 'block'; // Show current month
        }
    }

    // Function to change month when navigation arrows are clicked
    function changeMonth(direction) {
        currentMonth += direction;
        if (currentMonth < 1) {
            currentMonth = 12;
            currentYear -= 1;
        } else if (currentMonth > 12) {
            currentMonth = 1;
            currentYear += 1;
        }
        document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear;
        showCurrentMonth();
    }

    // Function to add a new task to the to-do list
    function addTask() {
        const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task');
        const taskName = taskInput.value.trim();
        if (taskName) {
            fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list');
                const newTask = document.createElement('li');
                newTask.className = 'todo-item';
                newTask.innerHTML = `<input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask(${data.id})"> âœ”ï¸ <span class="task-name">${data.name}</span>`;
                todoList.appendChild(newTask);
                taskInput.value = ''; // Clear the input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding task:', error));
        }
    }

    // Function to mark a task as complete
    function completeTask(taskId) {
        const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(`input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]`);
        const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span
        const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked;

        // Update the completed status visually
        taskName.classList.toggle('completed', isChecked);

        // Send update to the server
        fetch(`/complete_task/${taskId}/`, {
            method: 'POST',
            headers: {
                'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
            },
            body: JSON.stringify({ completed: isChecked })
        })
        .then(response => {
            if (!response.ok) {
                throw new Error('Network response was not ok');
            }
        })
        .catch(error => console.error('Error completing task:', error));
    }

    // Function to add a new important event
    function addEvent() {
        const eventName = document.getElementById('event-name').value.trim();
        const eventDate = document.getElementById('event-date').value;

        if (eventName && eventDate) {
            fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', {
                method: 'POST',
                headers: {
                    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
                    'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
                },
                body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate })
            })
            .then(response => response.json())
            .then(data => {
                const dateCell = document.querySelector(`td[data-date="${eventDate}"]`);
                if (dateCell) {
                    const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
                    eventDiv.className = 'event-name';
                    eventDiv.textContent = `ðŸŒŸ ${data.name}`;
                    dateCell.appendChild(eventDiv);
                }
                document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input
                document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the date input
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Error adding event:', error));
        } else {
            alert('Please enter both event name and date.');
        }
    }

    // Initial call to show the current month
    showCurrentMonth();
</script>

{% endblock %}

Key Improvements

  1. Separation of Concerns: The JavaScript code is organized into functions, making it easier to read and maintain. Each function has a clear purpose.

  2. Enhanced User Experience: The task completion and event addition processes are handled with clear feedback to the user.

  3. Improved Readability: The code is structured with meaningful class names and consistent styles, enhancing maintainability and readability.

  4. Responsive Styling: The inline styles are replaced with CSS class names, making it easier to change styles later.

  5. CSS Classes: Consider defining CSS styles for classes like .calendar-container, .calendar-heading, and others in your CSS file for better separation of styles.

CSS Enhancements (for better presentation)

You might want to create a

You said:
{% extends 'base.html' %} {% load static %} {% block content %} <!-- Navbar included from navbar.html --> {% include 'navbar.html' %} <!-- Main Page Container --> <div class="calendar-container" style="padding: 20px; margin-top: 100px; position: relative; background-color: rgba(240, 248, 255, 0.9); border-radius: 10px; box-shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);"> <!-- Heading for Performance Calendar --> <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 2.5rem; margin-bottom: 30px;">ðŸ—“ï¸ Performance Calendar</h2> <!-- Navigation Arrows --> <div style="text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px;"> <button onclick="changeMonth(-1)" style="font-size: 1.5rem; background-color: #59826b; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px; padding: 10px 15px;">&#10094;</button> <!-- Left Arrow --> <span id="current-month" style="margin: 0 20px; font-size: 1.5rem; display: {% if month.month == current_month %}block{% else %}none{% endif %};"> <h3 style="text-align: left; color: #2A4B38; margin-bottom: 15px;"> {{ month.year }} - {{ month.month_name }} ðŸŒŸ <span style="font-size: 1rem; border: 1px solid #ddd; text-align: left; {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); {% endif %}" data-date="{{ day.date }}"> {% if day.date %} <span style="color: darkgreen; <!-- Empty cell for unused days --> {% endif %} </td> {% endfor %} </tr> {% endfor %} </tbody> </table> </div> {% endfor %} </div> <!-- To-Do List Section --> <div class="todo-list-container" style="margin-top: 50px;"> <h2 style="text-align: center; width: 50%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;"> <button onclick="addTask()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Task</button> </div> <ul class="todo-list" style="list-style-type: none; padding-left: 0;"> {% for task in todo_tasks %} <li style="background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9); padding: 15px; margin-bottom: 10px; box-shadow: 0 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); border-radius: 5px;"> <input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask({{ task.id }})" {% if task.completed %}checked{% endif %}> âœ”ï¸ <span style="{% if task.completed %}text-decoration: line-through; color: gray;{% endif %}">{{ task.name }}</span> </li> {% endfor %} </ul> </div> <!-- Add Event Section --> <div style="margin-top: 50px;"> <h2 style="text-align: center; color: #3B6B8A; font-size: 1.75rem;">ðŸŽ‰ Add Important Event</h2> <div style="text-align: center;"> <input type="text" id="event-name" placeholder="Event name..." style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;"> <input type="date" id="event-date" style="padding: 10px; width: 30%; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 5px;"> <button onclick="addEvent()" style="padding: 10px; background-color: #3B6B8A; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 5px;">Add Event</button> </div> </div> </div> <script> let currentMonth = {{ current_month }}; let currentYear = {{ current_year }}; // Function to show the current month and hide others function showCurrentMonth() { const calendars = document.querySelectorAll('.calendar-month'); calendars.forEach(calendar => { calendar.style.display = 'none'; // Hide all }); const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})); if (currentCalendar) { currentCalendar.style.display = 'block'; // Show current month } } function changeMonth(direction) { currentMonth += direction; if (currentMonth < 1) { currentMonth = 12; currentYear -= 1; } else if (currentMonth > 12) { currentMonth = 1; currentYear += 1; } document.getElementById('current-month').innerText = currentMonth + ' - ' + currentYear; showCurrentMonth(); } function addTask() { const taskInput = document.getElementById('new-task'); const taskName = taskInput.value.trim(); if (taskName) { fetch('{% url "add_task" %}', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}' }, body: JSON.stringify({ name: taskName }) }) .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => { const todoList = document.querySelector('.todo-list'); const newTask = document.createElement('li'); newTask.innerHTML = <input type="checkbox" onchange="completeTask(${data.id})"> âœ”ï¸ <span>${data.name}</span>; todoList.appendChild(newTask); taskInput.value = ''; // Clear the input }) .catch(error => console.error('Error adding task:', error)); } } function completeTask(taskId) { const taskCheckbox = document.querySelector(input[onchange="completeTask(${taskId})"]); const taskName = taskCheckbox.nextElementSibling; // Get the corresponding task name span // Update the completed status const isChecked = taskCheckbox.checked; taskName.style.textDecoration = isChecked ? 'line-through' : 'none'; taskName.style.color = isChecked ? 'gray' : 'black'; // Send the completion status to the server fetch('{% url "complete_task" %}', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}' }, body: JSON.stringify({ id: taskId, completed: isChecked }) }) .catch(error => console.error('Error updating task completion:', error)); } function addEvent() { const eventName = document.getElementById('event-name').value.trim(); const eventDate = document.getElementById('event-date').value; if (eventName && eventDate) { fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}' }, body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: eventDate }) }) .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => { const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})); const dateCell = currentCalendar.querySelector(td[data-date="${eventDate}"]); if (dateCell) { const eventDiv = document.createElement('div'); eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347'; eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold'; eventDiv.innerHTML = ðŸŒŸ ${data.name}; dateCell.appendChild(eventDiv); } document.getElementById('event-name').value = ''; // Clear the input document.getElementById('event-date').value = ''; // Clear the input }) .catch(error => console.error('Error adding event:', error)); } else { alert('Please enter both event name and date!'); } } // Show the current month when the page loads document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', showCurrentMonth); </script> <style> .calendar-table { width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.786); font-size: 1.0rem; /* Adjust font size */ } .calendar-table th, .calendar-table td { padding: 30px; /* Increase padding for larger cells */ border: 1px solid #ddd; /* Cell border */ } .calendar-container { padding: 40px; /* Increase padding for the container */ } /* Update the heading size */ h2 { font-size: 3rem; /* Adjust heading size */ } </style> {% endblock %} u must add event with a click on calender no need of new inputs
ChatGPT said:

To enable adding events directly by clicking on the calendar date cells, you'll need to modify your JavaScript and HTML slightly. Hereâ€™s how you can do it:

  1. Update the HTML: Modify the calendar date cell <td> to include an onclick event handler that calls a function to add an event.

  2. Add JavaScript Logic: Create a function to handle the event creation when a date cell is clicked.

Hereâ€™s the updated code snippet with the required changes:

Updated Code

HTML/Template Changes:

html
<td style="padding: 30px; border: 1px solid #ddd; text-align: left; 
            {% if day.date and day.date == today_date %} 
            background-color: rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3); 
            {% endif %}"
            data-date="{{ day.date }}" onclick="promptEventName('{{ day.date }}')"> <!-- Add onclick event -->
    {% if day.date %}
        <span style="color: darkgreen; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.5rem;">{{ day.date|date:"j" }}</span>
        {% for event in important_events %}
            {% if event.date == day.date %}
                <div style="color: #FF6347; font-weight: bold;">ðŸŒŸ {{ event.name }}</div>
            {% endif %}
        {% endfor %}
    {% else %}
        &nbsp;
    {% endif %}
</td>

JavaScript Changes:

javascript
function promptEventName(date) {
    const eventName = prompt('Enter event name for ' + date);
    if (eventName) {
        addEvent(date, eventName); // Call the addEvent function with the date and name
    }
}

function addEvent(date, eventName) {
    fetch('{% url "add_event" %}', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
            'X-CSRFToken': '{{ csrf_token }}'
        },
        body: JSON.stringify({ name: eventName, date: date })
    })
    .then(response => response.json())
    .then(data => {
        const currentCalendar = document.querySelector(`.calendar-month:nth-of-type(${currentMonth})`);
        const dateCell = currentCalendar.querySelector(`td[data-date="${date}"]`);
        if (dateCell) {
            const eventDiv = document.createElement('div');
            eventDiv.style.color = '#FF6347';
            eventDiv.style.fontWeight = 'bold';
            eventDiv.innerHTML = `ðŸŒŸ ${data.name}`;
            dateCell.appendChild(eventDiv);
        }
    })
    .catch(error => console.error('Error adding event:', error));
}

Explanation of Changes

  1. onclick Event on <td>:

    • Each date cell now has an onclick event that calls promptEventName, passing the date of that cell.

  2. promptEventName Function:

    • This function prompts the user to enter the event name when they click on a date.

  3. Modified addEvent Function:

    • The addEvent function now accepts the date and event name as parameters and performs the fetch request to add the event.

Usage

Now, when a user clicks on a date cell in the calendar, they will be prompted to enter the event name. After entering the name, the event will be added to that date directly on the calendar.

Feel free to adjust the styling or the prompt message as needed!


ChatGPT can make mistakes. Check important info.
